item.title: HLT: Lifecycle and Wage Decomposition
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: GPT:The text discusses the decomposition of wages throughout individuals lifecycles using the APC (Age-Period-Cohort) panel model and the Heckman-Lochner-Taber (HLT) approach. The Mincer earnings function forms the basis for this analysis, focusing on the relationships between education level, work experience, and wages. However, traditional decompositions face challenges due to collinearity between age, birth year, and current year. Deatons method addresses this by isolating time and cohort effects, allowing for separate analysis. The HLT approach further dissects wage growth, suggesting that as individuals near retirement, wage growth is primarily influenced by the time effect rather than human capital investment. This comprehensive approach aims to better understand wage dynamics over the course of individuals lives, incorporating factors such as education, work experience, age, and cohort effects.

item.title: Zotero: RSS Feed Aggregation Subscription
item.author: 滑翔闪
item.description: GPT:The guide introduces economic journal RSS subscriptions, detailing various types of feeds and how to import them into Zotero. It covers a range of prestigious journals like AER, Econometrica, and QJE, providing direct RSS links for latest issues, advance access, open access. Additionally, it mentions platforms like Elsevier and CNKI for accessing foreign journals and offers interesting feeds like Zhihu Daily Selection and Terence Tao Blog.
